info.description: Type definitions

HTTP version, actually only 1.0 and 1.1 are supported. Note that 'supported' here means only 'accepted inside a HTTP request line', no different behaviours are actually implemented depending on HTTP version
HTTP method, actually only GET and POST methods are supported
authentication information
HTTP status
invalid header encountered
invalid header name encountered
invalid header value encountered
unsupported or invalid HTTP version encountered
unsupported or invalid HTTP method encountered
invalid HTTP status code integer representation encountered
invalid URL encountered
invalid query string encountered
invalid query string part encountered, arguments are parameter name and parameter value
invalid request URI encountered
malformed request received
malformed response received, argument is response's first line
a parameter you were looking for was not found
invalid HTTP status line encountered
an header you were looking for was not found
raisable by callbacks to force a 401 (unauthorized) HTTP answer. This exception should be raised _before_ sending any data over given out channel.

module_structure.comment: Helpers and other not better classified functions which should not be exposed in the final API

info.return: the current date compliant to RFC 1123, which updates RFC 822 zone info are retrieved from UTC

info.description: Convert a number of seconds to a date compliant with RFC 822
strip trailing '/', if any, from a string and
strip heading '/', if any, from a string and
given an HTTP response code return the corresponding reason phrase
like List.assoc but return all bindings of a given key instead of the leftmost one only
print a warning msg to stderr. Adds trailing \n
print an error msg to stderr. Adds trailing \n
URL type
Get the full path of an url (ie. including leading /, queries and fragments
Build an encoded string from an URL
Build an URL from an encoded string
URL encode the string
URL decode the string

module_structure.comment: Common functionalities shared by other OCaml HTTP modules

info.description: pretty print an HTTP version
parse an HTTP version from a string

raised_exceptions.text: if given string doesn't represent a supported HTTP version

info.description: pretty print an HTTP method
parse an HTTP method from a string

raised_exceptions.text: if given string doesn't represent a supported method

info.description: converts an integer HTTP status to the corresponding status value

raised_exceptions.text: if given integer isn't a valid HTTP status code

info.description: converts an HTTP status to the corresponding integer value

info.return: true on "informational" status codes, false elsewhere
true on "success" status codes, false elsewhere
true on "redirection" status codes, false elsewhere
true on "client error" status codes, false elsewhere
true on "server error" status codes, false elsewhere
true on "client error" and "server error" status code, false elsewhere

type.name: Http.Message.contents
type.manifest: [ `Inchan of int64 * Bitstring.t Lwt_stream.t | `String of string ]

value.name: Http.Message.init
value.type:
body:Http.Message.contents list ->
  headers:(string * string) list ->
  version:Http.Types.version -> Http.Message.message

info.description: parse 1st line of an HTTP request

raised_exceptions.text: if request 1st linst isn't well formed
if requested URI isn't well formed

info.return: a triple meth * url * version, meth is the HTTP method invoked, url is the requested url, version is the HTTP version specified or None if no version was specified

info.description: parse 1st line of an HTTP response

raised_exceptions.text: if first line isn't well formed

info.description: parse HTTP headers. Consumes also trailing CRLF at the end of header list

raised_exceptions.text: if a not well formed header is encountered

info.return: a list of pairs header_name * header_value

info.description: given an input channel, reads from it a GET HTTP request and
info.return: a pair <path, query_params> where path is a string representing the requested path and query_params is a list of pairs <name, value> (the GET parameters)

info.description: parse content-range header in a request
info.return: number of bytes to read, or None if all available should be read

value.name: Http.Request.init_request
value.type: unit Lwt.u -> (unit -> string Lwt.t) -> Http.Request.request Lwt.t

type.name: Http.Cookie.time
type.manifest: [ `Day of int | `Hour of int | `Minute of int | `Second of int ] list
